title: New Caledonia
text: First thing import gecevar library.

title: New Caledonia
text: example, take New Caledonia example. ’s French island near New Zeland Tonga’s islands. need begin find EPSG code New Caledonia. ’s can found epsg.io. Beware keep EPSG functions package. One small check https://www.naturalearthdata.com/ make sure New Caledonia available country_name. got output vector size 5. First output character extent New Caledonia according EPSG:3163. Four next output extent latitude longitude coordinates, (extent EPSG:4326).
code: name <- "New Caledonia" epsg <- 3163 all_extent <- transform_shp_country_extent(EPSG = epsg,                                            country_name = name,                                            shapefile_path = NULL,                                            extent_short = NULL) extent <- all_extent[1] extent_latlon <- as.numeric(all_extent[2:5])

what: Download environmental variables in one file
title: New Caledonia
text: One variable protected area named WDPA downloaded file. variable need identification country name. Make sure country name available www.protectedplanet.net. Otherwise leave country_name = NULL. chunk code take around 3min run.
code: environ_path <- get_env_variables(extent_latlon = extent_latlon,                                   extent = extent,                                   EPSG = epsg,                                    country_name = "New Caledonia",                                   destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC",                                   resolution = 1000,                                   rm_download = FALSE)

what: Download climatic variables in one file
title: New Caledonia
text: Climatic variables extract chelsa-climat.org. get get_chelsa_current function many variables. can find chelsa’s documentation variables downloaded. Variables give average value data recovered 1981 2010. variables available month like average temperature, min temperature, max temperature, precipitation, potential evapotranspiration (PET) Penman’s formula Thornthwaite’s formula, cloud area fraction (clt). Others variables annualy available : climatic water deficit (Penman’s formula Thornthwaite’s formula), number dry month (Penman’s formula Thornthwaite’s formula) 19 bio variables. function takes around 10min run.
code: climat_path <- get_chelsa_current(extent = extent,                                       EPSG = epsg,                                       destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC",                                       resolution = 1000,                                       rm_download = FALSE)

title: New Caledonia
text: Now can merge variables one file. chunk code take around 30 seconds run. case, gecevar.tif 35Mb weight file. Output absolute path gecevar.tif file just created.
code: merge_path <- merge_files(environ_path = environ_path,                           climat_path = climat_path,                            destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC")

title: New Caledonia
text: Extracted chelsa climate data five available models, namely, GFDL-ESM4, IPSL-CM6A-LR, MPI-ESM1-2-HR, MRI-ESM2-0 UKESM1-0-LL. Compute average models SSP choosen. function take around 40min run.
code: system.time({ get_chelsa_futur(extent = extent,                  EPSG = epsg,                   destination = "/home/pierre/Bureau/NC",                  resolution = 1000,                  phase = "2071-2100",                  ssp = 585,                  rm_download = FALSE)})

title: New Caledonia
text: Elevation extract soilgrids.org. Aspect, roughness slope computed gdal library. Solar radiation computed grass using elevation, aspect, slope roughness. Solar radiation calculated equinox day (20th March). Soilgrids data extract soilgrids.org. Distance sea computed gdal library. Distance road/place/watering place computed openstreetmap.org gdal library. Protected area extracted protectedplanet.net, enable extract countries. Climatic variables extracted chelsa-climat.org. Precise definition bio variables available chelsa-climat.org.
